title: Mark Bell Rugby League: Latest News, Videos and Photos of Mark Bell Rugby League
body:
Pacific Cup Final: New Zealand delivers record 30-0 victory over Australia

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Nov 04, 2023, 20:31 (IST)

New Zealand made history in rugby league with a resounding 30-0 victory over Australia in the Pacific Cup final. This victory not only secured New Zealand's win but also set a new record for the heaviest defeat handed to Australia. The Kiwis displayed dominance from the start, with outstanding performances from players like Joseph Tapine and Jamayne Isaako.

Cricket in the US? How Major League Cricket could herald a new American sport that country shunned 250 years ago

Times Network / Jan 19, 2024, 15:54 (IST)

Major League Cricket is taking America by storm, with investments from individuals like Satya Nadella and Shah Rukh Khan, as South Asians who want to stay connected to their cultural roots drive the resurgence of the sport, and experts believe it has the potential to become an Olympic discipline in the future.

Philadelphia Phillies cruise past Miami Marlins, advance to NLDS

Oct 05, 2023, 09:24 (IST)

The Philadelphia Phillies secured a spot in the NL Division Series against the Atlanta Braves after sweeping the Miami Marlins in the wild-card series. Bryson Stott's grand slam in the sixth inning played a crucial role in the Phillies' 7-1 victory. J.T. Realmuto also contributed with a home run and a double.

Playing through pain, how Neeraj Chopra surged to victories in 2023

TNN / Dec 31, 2023, 08:32 (IST)

Neeraj Chopra's performance in the 2024 Paris Olympics will determine his position among Indian greats. He completed all the necessary tasks to become a champion athlete this year. Neeraj's journey has been filled with preparation, discipline, and hard work. He understands that failure is a setback but also an opportunity for inspiration. Neeraj is not only a champion on the field but also a symbol of peace, voicing his opinion on important issues and supporting fellow athletes. The hunger for Olympic gold pushes him to work harder and achieve more for his country.

From Castle Corner to Castle Hill, Zimbabwe cricketers experience generational journey

Reuters / Sep 02, 2022, 13:54 (IST)

Zimbabwe, perpetual minnows of the game, have waited 18 long years to travel Down Under and face the might of Australia, and now, finally given the chance, they are being overshadowed by a rugby league match.

2nd Women's T20I: India's stunning batting collapse helps England seal series

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Dec 09, 2023, 22:26 (IST)

Indian bowlers staged a praiseworthy fightback while defending a low total of 81, however, England sealed the 3-match T20I series by beating the Women in Blue by four wickets in the second T20I at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium on Saturday.

Sporting events cancelled, tributes paid after Queen Elizabeth II dies

Reuters / Sep 09, 2022, 09:30 (IST)

The world of sport reacted to the death of Queen Elizabeth on Thursday with a raft of cancellations across cricket, golf, rugby and cycling, while others paid tribute by holding a minute's silence.

Franchises retain marquee players ahead of Women's Premier League 2024

Oct 19, 2023, 16:32 (IST)

The Women's Premier League (WPL) has confirmed that all key players, including Harmanpreet Kaur, Meg Lanning, and Smriti Mandhana, have been successfully retained by their respective franchises for the upcoming WPL 2024 season. The announcement came on October 15, marking the end of the player retention window for the five participating franchises.

South Africa face struggle to qualify for Cricket World Cup

AFP / Mar 24, 2022, 19:43 (IST)

Cricket World Cups have caused more heartache for South African supporters than any other format of the game. There have been agonising near-misses and numerous disappointments - but actually qualifying for the tournament has never previously been an issue.

Agustin Pichot quits World Rugby after election defeat

Reuters / May 13, 2020, 13:41 (IST)

Agustin Pichot has resigned from his role on the World Rugby Council and as president of Americas Rugby after his defeat by Bill Beaumont in the recent election for the post of the global body's chairman

Manchester City great Colin Bell dies aged 74

AFP / Jan 06, 2021, 11:46 (IST)

Former Manchester City and England midfielder Colin Bell has died aged 74 following a short illness, the club announced Tuesday. Bell scored 152 goals in 492 appearances for City during a 13-year career with the club after joining from Bury.

New Zealand sport set for fans boost with end to COVID-19 curbs in sight

Reuters / Jun 03, 2020, 13:40 (IST)

Professional sport in New Zealand could welcome fans back to stadiums as early as next week with the government set to decide whether to lift all social distancing restrictions imposed to due the COVID-19 pandemic.

Meet Tamil Nadu’s belles of the ball

TNN / Jan 18, 2022, 13:52 (IST)

A decade ago, Sandhiya Ranganathan, an orphan at the Cuddalore government hostel, chanced upon a few girls playing football at her school ground. She liked what she saw and decided to join the group.

Security fears stalk 2024 Paris Olympic organisers

AFP / Jul 22, 2022, 15:49 (IST)

Two years out from Paris hosting the Summer Olympics there is widespread concern over security, exacerbated by the dreadful spectacle of the chaotic scenes at the Champions League final at the Stade de France. Police tear-gassing frustrated Liverpool fans, including children and the disabled, was not the fault of the supporters but, according to a damning fact-finding mission by two French senators, the fault of the organisers.

WHO sees unprecedented Omicron spread, 'probably' in most countries

AFP / Dec 15, 2021, 09:52 (IST)

The World Health Organization warned Tuesday Omicron was spreading at an unprecedented rate and urged countries to act, as drug maker Pfizer said its coronavirus pill was effective against the variant. Dutch primary schools will close early as Europe battles a fresh wave of infections and hospital admissions, while British Prime Minister Boris Johnson faced a major parliamentary test seeking to impose fresh Covid curbs.

#YearEnder2020: BTS' virtual concert to Kartik Aaryan’s corona monologue: Things which helped us sail through 2020

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Dec 29, 2020, 12:00 (IST)

Despite the virus inviting a worldwide lockdown, we did lookout for different ways to heal and hope. While dalgona coffee and baking tones of cake were just the perfect way to embrace the initial stages of lockdown, few of us also learnt to look at the silver lining in things and situations. Somewhere it was the entertainment world which kept us busy, allowing us to laugh with our family or finally give ourselves ample time in listening to a music album.

title: Aiden Markram Joins Texas Super Kings In Major League Cricket
body:
South African cricketers Aiden Markram and Nandre Burger are set to join Major League Cricket teams after their stints in the Indian Premier League. Markram, who is currently playing for the Sunrisers Hyderabad in the IPL, expressed his excitement about joining former Proteas captain Faf du Plessis’ team, Texas.

Markram stated, “I’m very excited about this opportunity. Being part of the Super Kings brand, which has left a mark in various cricket leagues globally, is something I’ve admired for years. Playing alongside Faf du Plessis again is particularly thrilling, as he’s not only a great leader but also a remarkable individual.”

Nandre Burger also joins Texas Super Kings

Meanwhile, Burger, who is representing the Rajasthan Royals in the IPL, shared his enthusiasm about joining the Seattle Orcas in Major League Cricket’s upcoming season. Burger, who has gained international experience with two Tests, three ODIs, and one T20I since his debut in 2023, expressed his honor in joining the Orcas.

Burger commented, “I’m extremely honored and excited to join the Seattle Orcas for the upcoming season of Major League Cricket. I’m eager to contribute to the team’s success and look forward to joining them soon.”

Seattle Orcas, who finished as runners-up in MLC’s inaugural edition in 2023, will welcome Burger to bolster their squad. The team lost the final to MI New York, which featured South African players Dewald Brevis and Kagiso Rabada. This year, MI New York will include another Proteas fast bowler, Anrich Nortje, adding further competition to the league.
